definitions.text: directed or facing toward the back or rear
(used of temperament or behavior) marked by a retiring nature
having made less than normal progress
at or to or toward the back or rear
examples: she looked rearward out the window of the car

definitions.text: in a manner or order or direction the reverse of normal
examples: it's easy to get the `i' and the `e' backward in words like `seize' and `siege'
the child put her jersey on backward

definitions.text: in or to or toward a past time
examples: set the clocks back an hour
lovers of the past looking fondly backward
